main.name: Ryan Campisi
main.bio: I am a 22 year old student from the University of Florida, looking to get more involved in software engineering. I have a passion for education and technology and hope to one day contribute to the field of computer science in a meaningful way. I am currently looking for a full-time position in software engineering, and am open to any opportunities that may come my way.
main.contactmessage: Feel free to contact me for any questions are concerns. I am always open to new opportunities and am looking to get more involved in the field of software engineering.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science & Mathematics
description: Technologies: JavaScript, TypeScript, XML, JSON, MySQL, SQLite, CSS, HTML, Unity, Angular, React, Visual Studio, Flask, Python, C++, Java, Kotlin, MongoDB, Adobe Creative Cloud

education.school: Lakewood High School - Center for Advanced Technology

work.title: Expert AI Data Trainer
work.description: Collaborating closely with a team of fellow expert trainers, AI developers, and researchers, actively influencing the ongoing development of the AI model itself. Providing insights, feedback, and expertise that directly contributed to the evolution of the AI, making the role intellectually stimulating and instrumental in pushing the boundaries of AI technology.

work.title: Mathematics Tutor
work.description: Responsible for conducting private appointment tutoring for various calculus and algebra courses such as Calculus 1, 2, and 3, Linear Algebra, and Differential Equations.

work.company: UF Herbert Wertheim College of Engineering
work.title: Research Assistant
work.description: Assisted the Machine Learning & Sensing Lab on a project involving underwater hydrophones to research and understand coral reef ecosystems from an acoustics perspective.

work.title: Math Success Leader / Peer Coach
work.description: Responsible for leading weekly class sessions for Calculus students, grading Calculus papers, and conducting private appointment advising for STEM students looking to be successful in their transition to UWF.

projects.title: Canadian Wanderlust

projects.title: Fury Fighting Gear

projects.title: Smirkspace
projects.category: (MVP Only) A React and Meteor based chat University project.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Ryan Campisi must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
